poem:
"Upon The Broadcasting of Men"

In the dim portal of the screen,
Kyrgios squats, marred in old errors,
Bought by the BBC - a scene
Of masculine reign and terrors.
Mighty Tate, his crimes sever,
House arrest, his echo chamber,
No hero, but an unholy leaven.
Lucy's voice, the silencing endeavour,
Sifts the truth from lies and slanders.
